news.title: Thames Water halts bonus scheme as No 10 says rewarding failure 'not acceptable'
news.summary: The company pauses its "retention scheme", which pays out cash to top executives linked to its rescue loan.

news.title: World-first gonorrhoea vaccine launched by NHS England as infections soar
news.summary: The treatment will be offered to those most at risk from August after a record number of cases.

news.title: Student suicide review says unis must act to stop more deaths
news.summary: The government wants universities to check the safety of halls and reach out to families after a death.

news.title: Tropical forests destroyed at fastest recorded rate last year
news.summary: Tropical forests provide a buffer against climate change, but disappeared faster than ever recorded last year.

news.title: The Papers: 'This must end now' and 'Rayner's secret plan'
news.summary: Foreign Secretary David Lammy's rare condemnation of Israel's bombing of Gaza dominates Tuesday's papers.

news.title: Nicotine pouches helped me quit vaping â€“ but now I'm addicted
news.summary: Teenagers say it is easy to get hold of the products, which experts warn can be highly addictive.

news.title: New brain tumour test a 'game changer', say experts
news.summary: Scientists say the new method can diagnose the exact type of tumour within hours, rather than weeks.

news.title: India's Banu Mushtaq scripts history with International Booker win
news.summary: Mushtaq won the prize for the short story collection Heart Lamp, translated into English by Deepa Bhasthi.

news.title: 'Convinced he was Spurs-bound' - How Fernandes became Man Utd's heart
news.summary: As Bruno Fernandes leads Man Utd out against Tottenham in the Europa League final, BBC Sport look at his journey - including almost signing for Spurs.

news.title: Spurs and Man Utd meet in worst-form European final
news.summary: The winners of Wednesday's Europa League final between Manchester United and Tottenham will be the lowest league finishers ever to win a major European trophy. BBC Sport examines their seasons, motives and stats.
